communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Video Request | CRB2400522, Novak, Steven
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This is a request for DASHCAM and BWC video for the first two squads on scene and any subsequent BWC video related to the arrest of the primary suspect in this matter. (As a formality, this request is being made under open records statutes governing this data.)

Please also include the police report from the primary officer or the probable cause statement. You can exclude any PII. The narrative is the most important part. 

If the individual was NOT arrested on camera, please let us know as we will likely cancel the request. 

Suspect Name: Novak, Steven
Date of Birth: 1959/10/25
Pinella County Court Case Number: CRB2400522
Filing Date: 2024-07-24
Offense Date: 2024-07-12
Description: Poss. Drug Para

IF YOUR AGENCY DOES NOT USE BODY CAMERAS:
If you do not have a body camera video related to this incident, please let us know. We will likely cancel the request if your agency was not using BWC at the time of the incident. (Exception: State Troopers - we will still want state trooper dash cams.)

EXCLUDED FROM THIS REQUEST:
Exclude any portion of footage involving personally identifiable information (PII)
Exclude portions of the video in which minors are visible
Exclude portions involving nudity, explicit or graphic content (blur, redact, or cut)
Exclude any other portion of the video at your discretion. 

Thank you in advance for any consideration,
Allison Wheeler | Volunteer

title: CORA Logs (Cherry Hills Village City Clerk)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CORA Logs (Cherry Hills Village City Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting a Colorado Open Records Act (CORA) request seeking access to specific documents related to your department's activities for the 180 day period preceding today, from Friday, February 9, 2024, to Wednesday, August 7, 2024. Specifically, I am requesting:

1. All records of CORA requests sent to your department during the specified 180 day period.
2. All records of CORA responses issued by your department in response to external requests within the same timeframe.
3. A copy of the fee schedule for processing CORA requests and any associated costs.
4. A copy of your department's open records policy for reference.
5.Correspondence in relationship to CORA requests sent between government entities.

Please include details such as dates, requestors' names, and request contents in the CORA records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

Are you able to pay all fees or would you like as many records as can be gathered within a certain amount of time?

title: University of California Davis PRA Databases

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: University of California Davis PRA Databases
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1 — any databases and/or spreadsheets used to track requests under the California Public Records Act for the last 5 years from the date of this request.
2 — any and all policy documents, manuals, memos and/or reports regarding the processing of public records requests for the last 5 years from the date of this request.

In the regard to the database requested in paragraph 1, please provide the database in its original electronic format pursuant to Cal. Gov. Code § 6253.9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ed Burton

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: University of California Davis PRA Databases - UCDPRA24437
communications.communication:
Dear Ed Burton,

This email is to acknowledge your Public Records Act request submitted below. Appropriate University of California offices are being notified of your request and a search for the information is underway. All information identified as responsive to your request will be reviewed, and made available for your access, in accordance with relevant law and University policy. The estimated date for production of the requested records is on or around October 24, 2024.
Your request number is UCDPRA24437. Please feel free to 'reply all' should you have any questions or need additional information as we work to complete your request. Please feel free to visit our Campus Counsel <https://campuscounsel.ucdavis.edu/> website for additional information concerning records requests.

Thanks,
Lara

Lara H. Stilling
Information Practices Analyst
UC Legal – UC Davis Office of the Campus Counsel
One Shields Avenue, Davis, CA 95616
(530) 752-3189
https://campuscounsel.ucdavis.edu<https://campuscounsel.ucdavis.edu/>

title: Requesting MCAS tests and items (Department Of Elementary And Secondary Education)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Requesting MCAS tests and items (Department Of Elementary And Secondary Education)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all MCAS tests and items administered since its inception in 1993, organized by subject, grade level, and date of administration, *including* whether those items were used as part of test or MCAS re-test/re-take.

This material is being request for an educational purpose, specifically the analysis and exploration of test composition over time as part of a high school's education mission.

The Public Records Law requires you to provide me with a written response within 10 business days. If you cannot comply with my request, you are statutorily required to provide an explanation in writing.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alec Resnick

communications.subject: Welcome to the Public Records Center!
communications.communication:

Your Login ID is:  171582-08735001@requests.muckrock.com If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P004199-081324
communications.communication:
Dear Alec Resnick, 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education.  Your request has been received and is being processed.  Your request was received in this office on August 13, 2024 and given the reference number P004199-081324 for tracking purposes. To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all MCAS tests and items administered since its inception in 1993, organized by subject, grade level, and date of administration, *including* whether those items were used as part of test or MCAS re-test/re-take.

This material is being request for an educational purpose, specifically the analysis and exploration of test composition over time as part of a high school's education mission.

The Public Records Law requires you to provide me with a written response within 10 business days. If you cannot comply with my request, you are statutorily required to provide an explanation in writing.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alec Resnick

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fmassachusetts-department-of-elementary-and-secondary-education-24031%252Frequesting-mcas-tests-and-items-department-of-elementary-and-secondary-education-171582%252F%253Femail%253DESE.RAO%252540mass.gov&url_auth_token=AADnClAwpskJJp_jvYCNtyeVzKw%3A1se3lX%3Aw4UA2JbDxsFGSVV5Lk-BCL620a0CV2bcjqGgTgGg_m4

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P004199-081324
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hi Alec, 
The test questions that we have publicly released are available through this page: https://www.doe.mass.edu/mcas/testitems.html 
The test questions that we have not released are being kept for future use and are covered under exemption L of the public records law: questions and answers, scoring keys and sheets and other materials used to develop, administer or score a test, examination or assessment instrument; provided, however, that such materials are intended to be used for another test, examination or assessment instrument. The purpose of Exemption (l) is to prevent individuals from gaining an unfair advantage by using the Public Records Law to access test questions and answers prior to the administration of an examination. 
Best wishes, 
Jackie Reis 
jacqueline.reis@mass.gov

title: Correspondence records: operation to capture of Joaquin Guzman Lopez and Ismael Zambada, July 25, 2024

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Correspondence records: operation to capture of Joaquin Guzman Lopez and Ismael Zambada, July 25, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of correspondence to and from the ONDCP documenting the operation that delivered Joaquin Guzman Lopez and Ismael Zambada to the United States for arrest on July 25, 2024.

These records would be contained within the system of records with the name "Correspondence Management systems (CMS) for the Office of National Drug Control Policy (ONDCP)" and number "ONDCP/001."

Records could be identified by a search for records dating from July 12 to July 26 which are responsive to the following text strings:

"Joaquin Guzman Lopez"  also known as "Guero Moreno" and "Guero"
"Ismael Zambada" also known as "El Mayo" or simply "Mayo."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA 2024209
communications.communication:
I formally appeal the decision of the Office of National Drug Control Policy in FOIA# 2024209 ("operation to capture of Joaquin Guzman Lopez and Ismael Zambada, July 25, 2024"). 

I must express skepticism that there are no communications either sent or received by the Office regarding the arrest of two persons named in the 2024 National Drug Threat Assessment. Further, the ONDCP produced at least one public statement regarding the arrests, indicating it was notified of the arrest and had prepared comments. See: https://x.com/ONDCP/status/1816846123622928782

My prayer for relief is that the Office conduct a proper search and return responsive material.

-TM

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Fire Island Marine Serivce LLC -Inspection 1709320.015
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request concerns Inspection 1709320.015 and Report ID 0214700 concerning Fire Island Marine Services LLC at location 99 Maple Avenue Bay Shore, New York. 11706, which investigation was opened Nov. 8th 2023.  Request is made for the following documents,
1. All citations or penalties issued to the Employer,  Fire Island Marine Services LLC as a result of the investigation and final disposition including appeals and including amounts paid.
2. All investigation reports, findings, and conclusions on which the citations and penalties were based. 
3. All correspondence between OSHA and the Employer Fire Island Marine Services.
4. All photographs, videos, or other media related to the investigation.
5. All witness statements or memoranda, interviews conducted as part of the investigation. whether reduced to writing or recorded.
6. All communications from the Employer Fire Island Marine Services concerning Abatement or documentation of abatement.


Tabak , Mellusi & Shisha is not a Commercial use requester, nor is it an  Educational institution, noncommercial scientific institution, or representative of the news media.

Sincerely 

Tabak Mellusi & Shisha

By Ralph J. Mellusi

29 Broadway Suite 2400
New York, N.Y. 10006
Office Tel 212 962-1590
Office Fax 212 385-0920

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

RALPH Mellusi

communications.subject: FOIA 2024-F-14440/Fire Island Marine Services #1709320
communications.communication: Thisacknowledges the receipt of your 8/30/24, FOIA request for the above-mentioned file. As of today, it has been assigned to OSHA with tracking number 2024-F-14440,and you may track its status at . If you need to contact theagency about it for any reason, please reply to this email.  Please note that some items will be redactedor withheld in full as per the FOI Act.  Oncewe are done processing this casefile, we will contact you for either payment, orif the processing fees are under $25 we will forward the redacted casefile viaemail. (https://efoia.dol.gov/app/CheckStatus.aspx) https://efoia.dol.gov/app/CheckStatus.aspx

communications.subject: Fire Island Marine Services #1709320
communications.communication:
This is in response to your Freedomof Information request received in our office on 8/30/24 requesting the abovementioned file.  This record is nowavailable and has been enclosed for your information. You will note some informationhas been removed from the documents. This is authorized under the rules and regulations, includingexemptions, contained in the Freedom of Information Act and 29 CFR Part 70.  Actual sections deleted are indicated onAttachment #1, with numbered exemptions noted in each case.  For specific numbers and wording ofexemptions, please refer to Attachment #2 You have the right to appeal this decision with theSolicitor of Labor within 90 days from the date of this letter.  Theappeal must state, in writing, the grounds for the appeal, including anysupporting statements or arguments.  The appeal should also include a copyof your initial request and a copy of this letter. If you appeal, you may mail your appeal to: Solicitor ofLabor, U.S. Department of Labor, Room N-2420, 200 Constitution Avenue, N.W.,Washington, D.C. 20210 or fax your appeal to (202) 693-5538. Alternatively, you may email your appeal to foiaappeal@dol.gov (mailto:foiaappeal@dol.gov) ;appeals submitted to any other email address will not be accepted.  Theenvelope (if mailed), subject line (if emailed), or fax cover sheet (if faxed),and the letter indicating the grounds for appeal, should be clearly marked:“Freedom of Information Act Appeal.” In additio to filing anAppeal, you may contact the Department’s FOIA Public Liaison, Thomas G. Hicks,Sr. at (202) 693-5427 or hicks.thomas@dol.gov (mailto:hicks.thomas@dol.gov) for assistance in resolving disputes. You also may contact the Office of Government InformationServices (OGIS) for assistance.  OGIS offers mediation services to resolvedisputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusivealternative to litigation.  Using OGIS services does not affect your rightto pursue litigation.  You may mail OGIS at the Office of GovernmentInformation Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601Adelphi Road – OGIS, College Park, MD 20740-6001. Alternatively, you may email or contact OGIS through itswebsite at: ogis@nara.gov (mailto:ogis@nara.gov) ; Web: https://ogis.archives.gov (https://ogis.archives.gov/) .  Finally,you can call or fax OGIS at: telephone: (202) 741-5770; toll-free:1-877-684-6448. It is also important to note that the services offered byOGIS, is not an alternative to filing an administrative FOIA appeal. If we can be of further assistance to you, please feel freeto contact this office at 516-334-3344 or reply to this email. Enclosure ATTACHMENT #1 
Re:       Fire Island Marine Services 
#1709320 
Listing ofdeletions: Partial Deletions: (302 Pagesreleased) 
Complete Deletions: Pages 48,186,206,222,236,234,236,238,240,242,244, 246,248,250,252,272,288,294,296,298,300,302,304,306,308 (25 pages)- Blank 
Pages 121-135 (15 pages)- Employee Incident Report- Ex. 4,7c 

ATTACHMENT #2 Most used exemptions paragraphs from 5 U.S.C. Section 552(b): 
#4                  Information that is classifiedas trade secrets and/or of commercial or financial value obtained from a personand is privileged or a confidential source of information. 
#5                  Inter-agency or intra-agencymemorandums or letters which would not be available by law to a party otherthan an agency in litigation with the Agency. 
#6                  This exclusion is intended toexclude from disclosure all personal and medical files, and all private orpersonal information contained in other files which, if disclosed to thepublic, would amount to a clearly unwarranted invasion of the privacy of anyperson, including members of the family of the person to whom the informationpertains. 
#7                  Information contained ininvestigatory files complied for law enforcement purposes except to the extentavailable by law to a party other than an agency. 
#7(C)            Information pertaining to theprivacy interests of individuals, including                        information about anindividual which he could reasonably assert an option to withhold from thepublic at large because of its intimacy or its possible adverse effect uponhimself or his family. 
#7(D)            The identification of a confidentialsource or confidential information furnished by a confidential source.

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502
(505) 476 6133
(505) 827-8030 fax

communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

Julia Rock

communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

communications.communication:
Hello Renee,

Thank you for your continued partnership on this request. Please know that we are unable to access the SharePoint link you had provided. Our email address is not showing as associated with the link: 147140-15493170@requests.muckrock.com.

Please advise at your earliest convenience.

Thank You,

MuckRock Staff

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

We apologize for the error you received while trying to access the records. We will be using another method for delivery. Attached are the instructions that you will need to connect to the ERB SFTP server.  I will send you the credentials in a secure email to follow this.

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA2C20.B2CBD790]

communications.communication:
Thank you so much for your assistance, Renee. I was able to download the documents via the server instructions you provided. I look forward to your response on or before February 1st for the remaining documents.

Have a wonderful holiday season!

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Middlesex County Community College OPRA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any annual, quarterly, or semesterly logs or reports that detail how often carious school therapy services are provided to students. Please provide logs from the academic year beginning in 2014 through the present.

Any reports, logs, or other data that tracks average wait times for students who have sought help for mental health issues. Please provide logs from the academic year beginning in 2014 through the present.

The budget for mental health services for each year beginning in 2014 through the present.

Any reports, logs, or other data that tracks the number of mental health accommodations requested each school year, as well as the outcomes of those accommodation requests. Please provide records beginning in 2014 through the present. 

Any and all policies related to mental health, including but not limited to policies governing leaves of absence (voluntary and involuntary) for students, as well as any logs or reports that note the voluntary and involuntary leaves of absences students have taken each year since 2014.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Costo

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Middlesex County Community College OPRA
communications.communication:
Ms. Costo -

We are continuing to work to resolve the request that you've submitted.  We have encountered some issues as many of the staff that would have been charged with compiling some of the studies requested are unavailable due to the Coronavirus outbreak.  We have not been able to have the majority of our staff on campus since noon on March 19th.  Under the circumstances, we will need additional time.

Please feel free to reach out with additional questions.

Jeffrey Herron

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Middlesex County Community College OPRA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following New Jersey Open Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on March 16, 2020. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Middlesex County Community College OPRA
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Ms. Costo -

We are still operating under Executive Orders which have kept the majority of our employee base off campus due to the Coronavirus pandemic.  We are hopeful that these restrictions will be lifted soon, and that our employees will be in a position to respond to the request.  I will provide you an update no later than July 23rd as to the status of your request, and will certainly respond sooner if we are in a position to fulfill it.

Jeffrey Herron

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Middlesex County Community College OPRA
communications.communication:
Good morning -

The College is in receipt of your request.  As you are likely aware, the College is currently operating remotely due to the COVID-19 public health emergency.  Consistent with other public agencies, we are encountering difficulties responding to Public Records requests within the typical timeframe.  We would request an extension on this request to September 30, 2020 to allow our staff time to coordinate and provide the information to meet your query.  Personnel continue to be off campus that we will need to work with to provide your information, as an initial cursory review has not been able to locate materials within your request.

Please feel free to reach out with any questions.

Jeffrey Herron

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Middlesex County Community College OPRA
communications.communication:
Good morning –

The College is in receipt of this update request.  This is a matter that prompted numerous challenges during the timeframe that the request was made – the outset of the pandemic, coupled with the move of the College to remote operations for a significant period.

In the time that has passed there has also been turnover of oversight personnel in this area, along with an organizational restructuring of the College, with the creation of a Student and Enrollment Services Division at the macro level and a reconsideration of the reporting structure for the Counseling department within that Division.

The College would request an extension of time to provide responsive documents in this matter, during which time it will also assess requirements under the Open Public Records Act.  Any responsive documents provided will be for the timeframe considered under the original request.

The College will provide an update as to the status of this request no later than Thursday, August 8th, 2024.

[cid:image001.png@01DAB650.2C89FAD0]
Jeffrey Herron
Vice President, Institutional Effectiveness, Planning and Compliance

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Middlesex County Community College OPRA
communications.communication:
Good morning –

The following are our responsive documents to your request –

Any annual, quarterly, or semesterly logs or reports that detail how often various school therapy services are provided to students. Please provide logs from the academic year beginning in 2014 through the present.

  *   Middlesex College currently provides short-term confidential counseling to our students on campus or via telehealth through UWill. If the needs of students require help from outside providers, appropriate referrals have been made. Prior to 2021, mental health services were provided through our Counseling and Disabilities office and the data was not disaggregated by services provided.  ​
Data from January 21 through December of 2 2 is in the attached “Counseling Center Tracker” document.
Any reports, logs, or other data that tracks average wait times for students who have sought help for mental health issues. Please provide logs from the academic year beginning in 2014 through the present.

  *   Between 2014 and 2020, the Middlesex College Counseling and Disabilities office used a third party software that did not track average student wait times.
The budget for mental health services for each year beginning in 2014. (I can’t see below 2020 on Student Services)
Counseling Budget 113100
FY 2021 – 1,246,036
FY 2020 – 1,280,921
Any reports, logs, or other data that tracks the number of mental health accommodations requested each school year, as well as the outcomes of those accommodation requests. Please provide records beginning in 2014 through the present.

  *   Mental health accommodations are not tracked separately from other accommodations that were provided by our Counseling and Disabilities Office. There is no outcome data on file.

Any and all policies related to mental health, including but not limited to policies governing leaves of absence (voluntary and involuntary) for students, as well as any logs or reports that note the voluntary and involuntary leaves of absences students have taken each year since 2014.


  *   Information regarding policies related to mental health can be found through this link:
https://middlesexcollege.edu/student-life/counseling-services/
https://middlesexcollege.edu/about/college-leadership/board-of-trustees/policy-manual/
  *   Leave of Absence link:
https://www.course-catalog.com/mcc/C/2024-2025/content/enrollment-services-college-programs-and-activities/leave-of-absence/54

files.title: Counseling Center Tracker 21-22
files.source: Middlesex County College, Middlesex County, NJ

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: John "Sonny" Franzese Sr.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files, memos, emails and other records mentioning or describing John "Sonny" Franzese Sr. (February 6, 1917 – February 24, 2020), who was an Italian-American mobster who was a longtime member of the Colombo crime family.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously
    written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over
    100,000
    readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the
    People,
    Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable
    expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well
    established. In
    addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available
    through
    non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock,
    disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to
    this, a great
    deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the
    government itself.
    As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this
    particular
    subject in advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information
    to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch,
    Inc. v. Dep’t of
    Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of
    Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified
    because it also
    had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning
    United States
    foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I
    qualify as a member of
    the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the
    requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made
    by” a
    representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper
    reporter, for
    example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much
    interest there is
    in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the
    details of the
    request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
    category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and
    making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Deceased Individual

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix ARN SSN FBI Number Date of
Birth Place of Birth Date of Death Additional Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Files, memos, emails and other records mentioning or describing John "Sonny"
    Franzese Sr. (February 6, 1917 – February 24, 2020), who was an
    Italian-American mobster who was a longtime member of the Colombo crime
    family.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/81469/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/81469/John20Franzese2C20Mafioso20Who20Consorted20With20Celebrities2C20Dies20at2010320-20T.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fjohn-sonny-franzese-sr-88832%252F%253Femail%253Dfoipaquestions%252540ic.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2MnNxOre1oSHteLnfMK20oc%3A1j7Wib%3A14zgY0xFEbP_eTfSy7aPuf9TdrA

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Documents related to New College of Florida appointments

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Documents related to New College of Florida appointments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All memos, reports, transcripts and correspondence related to the January 2023 appointment of trustees to the New College of Florida described in the following press release

https://www.flgov.com/2023/01/06/governor-ron-desantis-appoints-six-to-the-new-college-of-florida-board-of-trustees/

This should include all correspondence to and from Gov. Ron DeSantis as well as all messages exchanged with the new trustees during recruitment. They are listed as: Christopher Rufo, Dr. Matthew Spalding, Dr. Charles R. Kesler, Dr. Mark Bauerlein, Debra Jenks, and Jason “Eddie” Speir.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Voluntary recognitions, July 1, 2023 - September 31, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide  records sufficient to determine the number of voluntary employee union recognitions from  July 1, 2023 through September 31, 2023. If available, please provide records about individual recognition with such fields as employer, location, description of bargaining unit, union, and size of unit, and any other non-exempt fields on Form NLRB-5581.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

communications.subject: Acknowledgment of Request
communications.communication:
10/04/2023Forest Greggre: FOIA Request number: 2024-NLFO-00015Dear Forest Gregg:This is an acknowledgment of receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated 10/2/2023 submitted to the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) FOIA Branch and seeking records pertaining to "To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:Please provide records sufficient to determine the number of voluntary employee union recognitions from July 1, 2023 through September 31, 2023. If available, please provide records about individual recognition with such fields as employer, location, description of bargaining unit, union, and size of unit, and any other non-exempt fields on Form NLRB-5581.The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Forest GreggUpload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https://www.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=%2Faccounts%2Fagency_login%2Fnational-labor-relations-board-197%2Fvoluntary-recognitions-july-1-2023-september-31-2023-152683%2F%3Femail%3Dnoreply%2540securerelease.us&url_auth_token=AAAbsACLXJHHBEYl1VA8we1O67I:1qnVRo:JAHgis2SFdWdH1piOPoq29peL1kIZIaEsToKFPXJ29o". We have docketed your request as 2024-NLFO-00015.  Please use this request number in all future correspondence concerning this request.  The NLRB FOIA Branch processes FOIA requests on "first-in, first-out" basis. The actual processing time will depend on the complexity of the request and whether or not it involves sensitive or voluminous records, or extensive searches and/or consultations. Please visit our website at https://www.nlrb.gov/guidance/freedom-of-information-act-foia/foia-reference-guide for more information about the FOIA and the NLRB FOIA regulations. If you have any questions about the status of your request, please feel free to contact me, Lalitta Gillis at (202) 273-0101 or by e-mail at lalitta.gillis@nlrb.gov.Sincerely,Lalitta GillisFOIA SpecialistFOIA BranchNational Labor Relations Board

09/13/2024 
Forest Gregg 
Muckrock News 

re: FOIA Request number 2024-NLFO-02390 

Dear Forest Gregg: 

This is in response to your FOIA Request dated 8/26/2024, received on 8/26/2024, and docketed as 2024-NLFO-02390. 

Your request has been received and processed with the following disposition: release in full. Please see the attached determination letter for more information about this disposition, our analysis of your request, and your appeal rights. 

Please use the following link to navigate to these records. This link will be active for one year. 

To retrieve the records associated with this request use this link Released Documents for Request 2024-NLFO-02390 or enter https://www.securerelease.us/request-details/451CC2F0-F047-412B-ADB5-32989D84D4AB/2 in your browser’s address bar. Please login or create a new user account using the email address associated with your records request: 152683-79240332@requests.muckrock.com (https://www.securerelease.us/request-details/451CC2F0-F047-412B-ADB5-32989D84D4AB/2) 

If you have any questions about your request, you may contact me, Jodilyn Breirather at (414) 930-7208 or by e-mail at jodilyn.breirather@nlrb.gov. 

Sincerely, 
Jodilyn Breirather 
FOIA Specialist 

FOIA Branch

title: Health and mental healthcare and juvenile justice (Division Of Juvenile Services North Dakota)

communications.subject: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: Health and mental healthcare and juvenile justice (Division Of Juvenile Services North Dakota)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

This is a request for records under your state public records law.  I am requesting copies of public records regarding health and behavioural health service delivery in youth correctional facilities in your jurisdiction, to inform a comparative research project regarding health and mental health care delivery in juvenile detention facilities across the US. Specifically, I request information regarding the following:
1. Name and contact details for those responsible for health and behavioural health services provisions at all locations where juveniles are incarcerated within your jurisdiction.
2. Regulations, policies and procedures that govern the operation of health and behavioral health provision for juveniles incarcerated within your jurisdiction. This includes health intake, room confinement, medication management,  access to specialist and dental services, discharge planning services, and other health and behavioral health related policies.
3. Contracts from January 1, 2021 to the time the request is filled between your agency and any healthcare provider including both physical health and behavioral health. 
4. Records concerning your jurisdiction’s most recent application to Centre for Medicaid Services (CMS) for an 1115 Medicaid waiver (if applicable), and any response, with specifically focus on how and whether such a waiver applies to provision of Medicaid funded services for detained juveniles.
5. Records relating to financing for health and behavioural health care delivery in your jurisdiction. 

I request the records be provided electronically. If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the administration of juvenile justice. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than allowed by statute, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies of the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Thank you for considering my request.

Sincerely,

Tess Kelly 
Fellow, Harvard FXB Centre for Health and Human Rights 

Joshua Dankoff
Director of Strategic Initiatives
Citizens for Juvenile Justice
617.338.1050

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Joseph Isadore Lieberman (February 24, 1942 – March 27, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former U.S. Senator Joseph Isadore Lieberman (February 24, 1942 – March 27, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/03/27/us/politics/joseph-i-lieberman-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an associate editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1628619-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000
Case Type:
FOIPA
Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.


Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into small (51-250 pages), medium (251-500 pages), large (501-4,999), and extra-large (over 5,000 pages) sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing. Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.
Currently, simple track cases average approximately 230 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Complex requests in the small processing track are currently averaging 1,085 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,310 days, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 2,370 days  .


Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Brazil NFL Football Game Halftime Show

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Brazil NFL Football Game Halftime Show
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any complaints received regarding the halftime show as displayed on NBC, Peacock, YouTube, ESPN,  or Hulu during the Green Bay vs. Philadelphia NFL game played in Sao Paulo, Brazil on September 6, 2024.

Please limit this request to communications generated between September 6, 2024 and the date this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tim Cushing

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Barry Seal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning Adler Berriman "Barry" Seal (July 16, 1939 – February 19, 1986) was an American drug smuggler, and aircraft pilot and dealer who flew flights for the Medellín Cartel. Proof of death is not required as the Bureau is aware of and has affirmed the subjects death.

These materials were previously requested under FOIA 1409885-000 and a significant page count provided, though the Bureau apparently closed the request and when I tried to reopen it, informed me that this was submitting a new request, which the negotiation team rejected because the statement was sent to the FOIA office's negotiation team. Rather than handle this in the simple, straightforward and appropriate way that any good faith actor would, you chose to obstruct the process and create more work for your own offices, for seemingly no other functional reason than to delay the release of the materials and/or to annoy me (mission accomplished, expletives deleted indeed). 

Once you open this request and re-locate the files, please connect me with the office's negotiation team, unless you'd like to waste more of your own personnel's "valuable" time.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires (lol).

Delightedly yours,

Emma Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1426310-000
communications.communication:
Yes. I would like the files. That's why I've filed several FOIAs about this, to get you to actually perform a search and produce the files. In April 2019, I informed you for this FOIA request that "we are seeking all records identified in response to FOIA 1409885-000." 

Please fulfill the multiple FOIAs I have filed and actually perform a search and produce the records.

It shouldn't be this hard to get you to actually search and start production. And yet here we are after what? six years of filing FOIA after FOIA on the same man. (In fairness to you, it's only been three and a half years since this particular FOIA was filed, which is less than 20 business days in FBI years.)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: case number 24033126 (report number: 24033126.1
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All body camera footage and photos for: case number 24033126 (report number: 24033126.1) from Domestic Violence investigation on 8/14/2024 at 19:30, where police officers documented injuries inflicted upon I.M by her boyfriend FV. The body camera footage and photos from this incident include (but not limited to) Officer Bret Bohan (badge # SD 1685).

The scope of the request is for all body camera and photos recorded for the above investigation on 8/14/2024 to 8/15/2024.

To save cost/labor to your agency, please provide the requested documents electronically to ssparker1428@gmail.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Parker

title: Deaths recorded (California Department Of Parks & Recreation)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Deaths recorded (California Department Of Parks & Recreation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am interested in gathering records that document any dead bodies found on public land managed by this agency, or reports of deaths on said land.

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records  restricted with the date range of 01/01/2020 to the time that this request is processed:
* WildCAD Incident Cards
* INCIDENT RECORDS 
Note: these may be helpful parameters for any incident reports:
Incident status closed, death of offender
Involvement: deceased
*  Any weekly, monthly, quarterly, or annual reports regarding deaths on public land managed by this agency

When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released. I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method, and again, please release documents on a rolling basis, as they become available.

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Also, I am a member of the news media as a reporter for Business Insider, and the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. If fees associated with this request will be in excess of $25, kindly notify me in advance of fulfilling this request. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is timely, I would appreciate your communicating with me if you have questions regarding this request.

Thanks again, and if there are any questions about my request, can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of my request, please contact me at email address. I am also happy to hop on the phone.

I look forward to your reply within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires and an even more prompt reply if you can make a determination without having to review the records in question.

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Best,
Caroline

communications.communication:

The most recent contract (i.e. council resolution, contract extension, contract amendments, cure notices, or other revisions to agreements) between the city and SoundThinking, Inc., formerly ShotSpotter, Inc.. This document(s) should include the total cost over the life of the contract and the current expiration date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Wourms

Thank you for registering with the Camden County Open Public Records Center.  Please log in to the Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Login: 172356-13988035@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password, you may request a temporary password here:

communications.subject: Open Public Records Act Request :: W029903-082424
communications.communication:
Steffani Lon  
 
 Custodian of Records  Telephone: (856) 225 – 2131 
 Camden County Administration   
 520 Market Street, 8th Floor 
 Camden, NJ 08102-1375 
Dear Jacob Wourms: 
 
Thank you for submitting an Open Public Records request with Camden County. Your request was given the reference number W029903-082424 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Our office will forward your request to the appropriate Department for their review and search of their files for the requested records. A written response will be sent to you within seven business days or sooner depending on the type of records requested. 
 
 
Please note that day one of the calculation begins the day after the custodian receives your OPRA request. This calculation applies to the agency’s actual business days of operations which are 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. If the agency is closed for a Holiday, this date does not count towards the seven business day deadline. Any request received after the close of business will be deemed received on the next business day. 
 
You may monitor the progress of your request at the link below. Additionally, you will receive an email from our office to inform you when your request has been completed and a response is posted at the below link. 
 
Again, thank you for using the Open Public Records Center. 
 
 
Open Public Records Center - http://www.camdencounty.com/open-public-records-opra/ 
 
Steffani Lon 
Custodian of Records

communications.communication:

Dear Rose Terse: 
This concerns your request C192645-080824 for graffiti-nuisance notices issued by the City Seattle. 
We have generated a list of property owners and their addresses to whom we have sent notices. We will also provide you with the sample letters used. 
Washington state law prohibits the use of individuals’ names for commercial purposes (RCW 42.56.070[8]). You will need to complete and sign a Declaration of Noncommercial Use so that we may evaluate your request. I have uploaded the form to your request account under the Attachments tab. 
Please upload or mail a copy of the the declaration by September 9, 2024. If we do not receive a copy by then, we will consider your request cancelled. The Public Records Act’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review of our response will begin to run as of that date. 
Thank you. 
Sincerely,

206-733-9836

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #C192645-080824
communications.communication:
Hello Norman,

Respectfully, I decline to sign your affidavit. While I will not be using these records for commercial purposes as stated in my initial request, I requested copies of notices issued by the City and did not request a list of names. Your interpretation led you to creating a list of names presumably because the original records are not available. Following how you interpret RCW 42.56.070 to apply to my request for City-issued notices, I would expect all public records requests that yield records containing multiple names to be subject to this law. If I were to ask for emails sent by the Mayor's Office (which I have many times without being required to sign an affidavit), you would argue that because multiple senders and recipients appear in the records, I must sign your affidavit. May I remind you that the PRA is to be "liberally construed and its exemptions narrowly construed".

Additionally, the law you cite (RCW 42.56.070(8)) only applies to "lists of individuals". As seen depicted in this article, the letter is addressed to "Fortuna Sequitur LLC" which is the entity that runs the Bait Shop business. Nowhere in this letter do I see the name of any individual listed, so I do not see why the list you are creating would be deemed "a list of individuals".
https://www.kuow.org/stories/graffiti-was-carved-into-their-windows-the-city-wants-these-seattle-bars-to-fix-it-or-pay-up

I respectfully ask that I be provided the full breadth of requested information, as is my right under the PRA.

Thank you,
Rose

communications.subject: Public Utilities - General :: C192645-080824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Rose: 
Thank you for replying to our request to declare noncommercial use of a list of individuals who have received graffiti nuisance notices from Seattle Public Utilities. We accept your statements, in lieu of the signed declaration, and will supply you with responsive data. 
It is through reports and lists in electronic form that we document and track nuisance notices, instead of individual letters. The list you will receive includes both business and individuals' (nonbusiness) names. It is for the latter information, coupled with associated residential addresses, that SPU is obligated, under RCW 42.56.070(8), to inquire about and investigate further. 
Please expect a message to follow soon releasing the data. 
Sincerely, 
J. Norman Dizon 
Public Disclosure Officer 
Seattle Public Utilities 
206-733-9836

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #C192645-080824

  *  Navigate to the Public Records Request Center 
  *  Select My Records Request Center. 
  *  Select View My Requests. Log on if asked. 
  *  Select C192645-080824. 
  *  Select View Files. 
  *  Click on the file link and save to your PC. Extract contents of the compressed (ZIP) file. 
Files will be available online for 30 days. 
Data and documents were supplied by SPU's Clean City Division and the City Department of Finance and Administrative Services which administers the online customer service request system. Notices before 2021 have not been retained in the system. 
This completes and closes your request. If you have follow-up questions or would like to appeal this response, please contact me within 14 days. The Public Records Act’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review of our response begins to run as of this date. Please contact me with any questions. Sincerely, J. Norman Dizon Public Disclosure Officer Seattle Public Utilities

I'm following up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Aug. 8, 2024. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Sept. 9, 2024. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #C192645-080824.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Public Utilities - General :: C192645-080824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Rose: 
We have redone the query of graffiti nuisance notices from our customer service system to include dates of the notices. The data is available for you to download. 
According to the system administrators, the actual date on the letter, i.e. when it was printed, is not captured in the system per se, only the date the printing task is completed. The latter is the date that is documented on the redone sheet, which is likely very close to, if not the same, date when the letter was mailed. 
I also asked the data administrators to include other data points that appeared on the letter, such as the description of the graffiti, which was not on the first sheet. 
This completes and closes your request. If you have follow-up questions or would like to appeal this response, please contact me within 14 days. The Public Records Act’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review of our response begins to run as of this date. 

Sincerely, 
J. Norman Dizon 
Public Disclosure Officer 
Seattle Public Utilities 
206-733-9836

communications.subject: Acknowledgment MPIA 24-1453
communications.communication:
Dear Emma Parry:



This is an acknowledgement of your request below, for public information, submitted to the Document Compliance Unit ("DCU") of the Baltimore Police Department ("BPD").  Your request is governed by the Maryland Public Information Act ("PIA"), Maryland Code, General Provisions Article ("GP"), Sections 4-101 et seq.  DCU will process your request promptly.  However, our response may take longer than ten (10) working days, the reasons for which may include the scope of your request, the type and volume of potentially responsive records, and the nature of the search, review, and preparation that is required.  In any event, DCU will respond to your request within thirty (30) days. GP § 4-203.



DCU will contact you with the availability of records and the possible costs associated with this request, as soon as the information is made available by the Custodian of Records.  Likewise, if DCU and/or the Custodian of Records need you to clarify your request, DCU will contact you promptly.


Please understand that the DCU staff receive an overwhelming number of requests a month and we are working diligently to respond to each and every request as quickly as possible. We appreciate your patience; response to document requests may take longer than normal.



Please refer to tracking # MPIA 24-1453 in any subsequent correspondence pertaining to this matter.  All follow up correspondence should be made in writing and submitted to the DCU's e-mail: DCU@baltimorepolice.org<mailto:DCU@baltimorepolice.org>.
Thank you,
Sade Sesay
